actor_awards.notes: A celebrated character actor best known for his portrayals of sniveling villains, psychopathic gangsters, and western outlaws. He was a staple of the film noir genre. He received an Emmy nomination for his role in the TV series 'Peyton Place'.

filmography.title: Scarlet Street
filmography.role_description: A manipulative and abusive pimp who cons a mild-mannered cashier, leading to a tragic outcome.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged painter meets a young woman and her con artist boyfriend who exploit his talent and generosity.

filmography.title: The Woman in the Window
filmography.role_description: A crooked ex-cop and blackmailer who threatens a professor involved in an accidental killing.
filmography.plot: A conservative professor engages in an innocent flirtation with a femme fatale, leading to murder and a cover-up.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Little Foxes
filmography.role_description: The weak-willed and greedy nephew who is manipulated by his uncles into stealing bonds.
filmography.plot: The ruthless, money-grubbing Hubbard clan fights for control of a family business, with their young daughter caught in the middle.

filmography.title: Winchester '73
filmography.role_description: A crazed, laughing outlaw who becomes one of the temporary owners of the coveted rifle.
filmography.plot: A cowboy tracks a stolen prize rifle through the hands of various characters, leading to a confrontation with his brother.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild Award: Nomination – Best Written American Western

filmography.title: Criss Cross
filmography.role_description: A ruthless mobster who marries the protagonist's ex-wife and orchestrates an armored car robbery.
filmography.plot: An armored truck driver gets caught in a web of betrayal when he tries to rekindle a romance with his ex-wife, now married to a gangster.

filmography.title: Ball of Fire
filmography.role_description: A gangster who hides out with a group of professors while waiting to marry his showgirl girlfriend.
filmography.plot: A group of professors working on a new encyclopedia encounter a mouthy nightclub singer who is wanted by the police to help bring down her mobster lover.

filmography.title: Too Late for Tears
filmography.role_description: A sleazy private eye and blackmailer who gets entangled with a femme fatale over a bag of stolen money.
filmography.plot: A ruthless woman finds a suitcase full of money and goes to great lengths to keep it, manipulating everyone around her.

filmography.title: Black Angel
filmography.role_description: An alcoholic musician who teams up with a woman to clear her husband of murder, only to discover a dark truth.
filmography.plot: A man is falsely convicted of murder, and his wife teams up with the victim's alcoholic ex-husband to find the real killer.

filmography.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
filmography.role_description: A mild-mannered oil company accountant who struggles to survive a plane crash in the desert.
filmography.plot: After a plane crash in the Sahara, one of the survivors announces that he's an airplane designer and they can make a flyable plane from the wreckage.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Ian Bannen)

filmography.title: Ride Clear of Diablo
filmography.role_description: A cynical, laughing outlaw who takes a liking to the protagonist and helps him seeking revenge.
filmography.plot: A railroad surveyor seeks revenge for the murder of his father and brother, teaming up with a notorious outlaw.

filmography.title: The Pride of the Yankees
filmography.role_description: A sportswriter who is initially skeptical of Lou Gehrig but eventually becomes a supporter.
filmography.plot: The story of the life and career of the famous baseball player Lou Gehrig.

filmography.title: Sahara
filmography.role_description: An American soldier who is part of the tank crew defending a well against the Germans.
filmography.plot: After the fall of Tobruk, a sergeant leads his tank crew across the Libyan desert, picking up stragglers and making a stand at a ruined well.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (J. Carrol Naish)

filmography.title: Ministry of Fear
filmography.role_description: A mysterious tailor involved in a Nazi spy ring in London.
filmography.plot: A man is released from an asylum into World War II London and inadvertently stumbles upon a Nazi spy ring.

filmography.title: Thunder Bay
filmography.role_description: An oil rigger and partner to James Stewart's character, facing hostility from local fishermen.
filmography.plot: Two ex-Navy engineers try to build an oil drilling platform off the coast of Louisiana, clashing with local shrimp fishermen.

filmography.title: Night Passage
filmography.role_description: The leader of an outlaw gang and the brother of the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A fired railroad worker is hired to guard a payroll from a gang of outlaws, who happen to be led by his own brother.

filmography.title: The Burglar
filmography.role_description: A professional burglar who tries to protect his 'sister' while dealing with a corrupt cop.
filmography.plot: A burglar and his crew pull off a diamond heist, but the police and a crooked cop are hot on their trail.

filmography.title: Along Came Jones
filmography.role_description: A dangerous outlaw whom Gary Cooper's character is mistaken for.
filmography.plot: An easygoing cowboy is mistaken for a notorious outlaw and has to rely on the outlaw's girl to save him.

filmography.title: World for Ransom
filmography.role_description: A private investigator in Singapore who gets involved in a nuclear kidnapping plot.
filmography.plot: A private eye in Singapore gets mixed up with a ring of kidnappers holding a nuclear scientist for ransom.

filmography.title: Silver Lode
filmography.role_description: A man claiming to be a federal marshal who accuses a respected citizen of murder on his wedding day.
filmography.plot: A man's wedding is interrupted by four men who claim he is a murderer and thief, turning the town against him.

filmography.title: Chicago Calling
filmography.role_description: A man struggling with alcoholism and poverty who desperately waits for a phone call about his injured daughter.
filmography.plot: A down-on-his-luck man tries to raise money to pay his phone bill so he can receive news about his daughter.

filmography.title: The Underworld Story
filmography.role_description: A blacklisted reporter who buys a stake in a small-town newspaper and uncovers a murder frame-up.
filmography.plot: A big-city reporter buys a small-town newspaper and tries to clear a woman falsely accused of murder.

filmography.title: Manhandled
filmography.role_description: A crooked private investigator who tries to pin a murder on an innocent woman.
filmography.plot: A secretary and a private eye get involved in a murder investigation involving stolen jewels and a psychiatrist.

filmography.title: Battle Hymn
filmography.role_description: A scrounging sergeant who helps Rock Hudson's character save Korean war orphans.
filmography.plot: A pilot haunted by a mistake in WWII rejoins the Air Force in Korea and starts an orphanage.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Film Promoting International Understanding

filmography.title: Johnny Stool Pigeon
filmography.role_description: A convict released from prison to help a federal agent infiltrate a heroin smuggling ring.
filmography.plot: A treasury agent recruits a convict to help him bust a drug ring operating out of Canada.

filmography.title: Mrs. Parkington
filmography.role_description: A suitor to the main character in this generational family drama.
filmography.plot: A lady's maid marries a wealthy man and rises in society, recounting her life story at age 84.

filmography.title: Larceny
filmography.role_description: A suave con man who plans to swindle a war widow out of her money.
filmography.plot: A con man tries to swindle a war widow into funding a fake memorial for her husband.
